acute respiratory distress syndrome.descr: Respiratory disease characterized by the rapid onset of widespread inflammation in the lungs.

i18n.es: síndrome de dificultad respiratoria aguda, (syn.) SDRA
i18n.fr: syndrome de détresse respiratoire aiguë, (syn.) SDRA
i18n.ja: 急性呼吸窮迫症候群, (syn.) 急性呼吸促迫症候群, ARDS
i18n.pt: síndrome do desconforto respiratório agudo, (syn.) SDRA
i18n.zh: 急性呼吸窘迫综合征, (syn.) ARDS

ageusia.descr: Disorder characterized by loss of taste.

angiotensin-converting enzyme.descr: Class of ectoenzymes found in, e.g., the lungs, heart, skin, or blood vessels, whose function is to cleave circulating peptides, among which angiotensinogen, which are then used to regulate specific cell functions.

i18n.es: enzima convertidora de la angiotensina, (syn.) ECA
i18n.fr: enzyme de conversion de l'angiotensine, (syn.) ECA
i18n.ja: アンジオテンシン変換酵素, (syn.) ACE
i18n.ru: ангиотензин-превращающий фермент, (syn.) АПФ (syn.) ангиотензин-конвертирующий фермент, (syn.) АКФ
i18n.zh: 血管紧张素转换酶, (syn.) ACE

anosmia.descr: Disorder characterized by loss of smell.

antibody.descr: Protein produced by B lymphocytes that can recognize and neutralize an antigen.

i18n.ja: 抗体, (syn.) 免疫グロブリン

antigen.descr: Particle, typically a protein, which the immune system recognizes as foreign.

asymptomatic transmission.descr: Mode of transmission of an infectious disease to another person from an infected person who does not develop symptoms.

attack rate.descr: Proportion of people that contract a disease in a population initially free of the disease, i.e. during a disease outbreak.

biostatistics.descr: Application of statistical methods and tools to the fields of biological sciences and medicine, including study design, data collection and analysis, and interpretation of findings.

blood plasma.descr: Liquid part of the blood in which red and white blood cells and platelets are suspended and which carries such blood cells as well as proteins, mineral salts, sugars, fats, and hormones throughout the body.

case.descr: Person who is diagnosed as having a disease.

case definition.descr: Set of criteria used to decide whether a person has contracted a specific disease.

casual contact.descr: Person who has been in the proximity of a person affected by an infectious disease but does not live with or care for the infected person.

chain of infection.descr: Process in which an infectious agent leaves its reservoir or host through a portal of exit, is conveyed by a mode of transmission, and enters a susceptible host through a portal of entry.

i18n.ja: 感染の連鎖, (syn.) 感染成立の連鎖

cluster.descr: Aggregation of cases of a disease within a given place and time.

confirmed case.descr: Case that is confirmed by a laboratory test.

contact.descr: Person who has been in the proximity of another person affected by an infectious disease and who is at risk of having contracted this disease.

contact follow-up.descr: Process of monitoring the contacts of a case for symptoms of the disease.

i18n.ja: 接触者のフォローアップ
i18n.pt: seguimento de contatos, (syn.) acompanhamento de contatos

contact identification.descr: Process aimed at identifying all contacts of a case by asking about the activities of the case and the activities and roles of the people around the case since the onset of the disease.

i18n.pt: identificação de contatos, (syn.) identificação de contactos (pt-PT)

contact tracing.descr: Process of identification, listing and follow-up of contacts.

i18n.pt: rastreamento de contatos, (syn.) rastreamento de contactos (pt-PT)

containment.descr: Strategy adopted by a public body to cut off transmission of a disease.

convalescent plasma therapy.descr: Therapeutic treatment whereby the blood plasma donated by individuals who have recovered from an infectious disease is introduced into the blood of people who are suffering from the same disease in order to help control the symptoms and limit the progression of the disease.

i18n.fr: utilisation thérapeutique de plasma de convalescents
i18n.pt: terapia com plasma convalescente, (syn.) tratamento com plasma convalescente
i18n.zh: 恢复期血浆治疗, (syn.) 康复者血浆治疗

coronavirus.descr: Family of viruses that consist of a core comprising a positive-sense single-stranded RNA, an envelope, a capsid, and spikes.

i18n.ja: 新型コロナウイルス感染症, (syn.) COVID-19

cytokine release syndrome.descr: Systemic inflammatory response syndrome caused by a large and rapid release of cytokines into the blood, which may be triggered by different factors, e.g. a viral infection or the use of certain drugs in immunotherapy.

i18n.es: síndrome de liberación de citocinas, (syn.) tormenta de citocinas
i18n.ja: サイトカイン放出症候群, (syn.) CRS

disease.descr: Abnormal condition that has a negative impact on the structure or function of all or part of an organism, generally associated with certain signs and symptoms.

disease outbreak.descr: Cluster of a disease with a common cause and an overall number of cases that is inferior to that of an epidemic.

i18n.ja: 集団発生, (syn.) アウトブレイク

deoxyribonucleic acid.descr: Double-stranded nucleic acid whose nucleotides consist of a backbone made up by a modified sugar, called deoxyribose, a nitrogenous base, i.e. adenine, guanine, cytosine, and thymine, and a phosphate group.

i18n.ja: デオキシリボ核酸, (syn.) DNA

drive-through testing.descr: Method of performing swab tests on people whilst they remain in their vehicles.

i18n.ru: тестирование по принципу «не выходя из машины»

elimination.descr: Strategy adopted by a public body to reduce to zero the incidence of a disease in a given geographical area.

endemic disease.descr: Disease for which there are as many cases as would be expected in a given population at a given time.
endemic disease.tag: MEDI, Public health & hygiene Public health & hygiene

environmental cleaning.descr: Set of actions and processes, including cleaning, disinfecting and monitoring, implemented in places at risk of spread of an infectious agent through contaminated objects.

epidemic curve.descr: Graphical representation of the incidence of a disease or other health-related event plotted over time.

epidemic disease.descr: Disease for which there are many more cases than would be expected at a given time in a given population and which can be ascribed to the same cause.

epidemic threshold.descr: Number of individuals within a population at risk that is required for an epidemic to occur.

i18n.pt: limite epidêmico, (syn.) limiar epidêmico, limiar epidémico (pt-PT)

epidemiology.descr: Scientific study of the occurrence of a disease or other health-related event in specified populations, and its application to the control of health problems.

filtering facepiece respirator.descr: Respiratory protective equipment that uses filters to remove hazardous substances from the air being breathed by the wearer.

i18n.fr: masque de protection respiratoire, (syn.) masque FFP
i18n.ja: フィルター式フェイスピースレスピレーター

fomite.descr: Inanimate object contaminated by an infectious agent that can indirectly transmit an infectious disease.

gene.descr: Sequence of DNA that carries the required information for making a specific molecule, typically a protein.

gene therapy.descr: Therapeutic treatment whereby one or more foreign genes are inserted into the genome of an organism by means of a vector, to compensate for abnormal genes or to help the organism produce a protein that can be beneficial for it.

genome.descr: Complete set of DNA of a living organism, including all of its genes.

hand sanitizer.descr: Gel, foam, or liquid used for handwashing that may or may not contain alcohol.

i18n.ru: кожный антисептик, (syn.) антисептическое средство для рук, санитайзер

hand washing.descr: Action of removing any unwanted substance or microorganism from a person's hands using water or another liquid, with or without soap or other detergents.

herd immunity.descr: Indirect protection from an infectious agent achieved in a population at risk when a sufficiently large proportion of individuals in the population show an acquired immunity to that infectious agent.

i18n.es: inmunidad de grupo, (syn.) inmunidad colectiva, inmunidad de rebaño

high-risk group.descr: Part of a population at risk that has higher than average prevalence, incidence or severity of a disease.

i18n.ja: ハイリスク群, (syn.) 高危険群

hospitalization.descr: Admission and stay of a patient in a hospital for treatment.

host.descr: Person or animal infected by an infectious agent.

hygiene.descr: Set of practices that help to maintain health and prevent the spread of diseases.

immunity.descr: Condition of being protected against an infectious disease.

incubation period.descr: Lapse of time between the exposure to an infectious agent and the onset of the symptoms of a disease.

index case.descr: The first known case of the outbreak of a disease in a cluster.

i18n.ja: インデックスケース, (syn.) 発端者,  最初の患者

indirect contact transmission.descr: Mode of transmission that occurs when an infectious agent is transferred from a reservoir to a host by means of a vehicle, i.e. water, food or air, a vector or a fomite.

infectious agent.descr: Biological agent that may or may not cause an infectious disease.

i18n.ja: 感染病原体, (syn.) 感染因子

infectivity.descr: Ability of an infectious agent to enter, survive, and multiply in a host.

inflammation.descr: Series of innate immunity processes initiated by the body in response to an injury.

intensive care unit.descr: Hospital facility that provides critical care and life support for acutely ill or injured patients.

i18n.es: unidad de cuidados intensivos, (syn.) unidad de terapia intensiva, UCI, UTI
i18n.ru: отделение реанимации и интенсивной терапии, (syn.) ОРИТ
i18n.zh: 重症监护室, (syn.) 加护病房

lockdown.descr: Strategy adopted by a public body because of an emergency that requires people to remain in a certain location which they may not leave other than for exceptional reasons.

i18n.ja: 都市封鎖, (syn.) ロックダウン

mask.descr: Commercially produced or homemade covering for nose and mouth used to reduce the spread of respiratory droplets from the wearer to others.

mechanical ventilation.descr: Lung ventilation provided by driving fresh air into the lungs by positive pressure and/or by pumping expiratory air out of the lungs by negative pressure.

i18n.ru: искусственная вентиляция лёгких, (syn.) аппаратное дыхание, ИВЛ

medical care.descr: Administration and delivery of healthcare by professionals.

medical glove.descr: Personal protective equipment for the hands typically worn by healthcare professionals to protect themselves from exposure to infectious agents or other biological, chemical or physical hazards.

mitigation.descr: Strategy adopted by a public body to reduce the number of infected people in a given geographical area and limit the impact on the health system of a disease outbreak.

mode of transmission.descr: Means by which an infectious agent spreads from one host to another.

monoclonal antibody.descr: Laboratory-produced molecule that targets and attacks specific antigens, thereby triggering a specific immune response.

i18n.ja: モノクローナル抗体, (syn.) 単クローン抗体

morbidity.descr: Level of health and well-being of an individual.

nasopharyngeal swab test.descr: Method of collecting a specimen of nasal secretions for diagnostic purposes by inserting a swab into each nostril, extending it back into the nasopharynx, leaving it in place for a few seconds, and slowly withdrawing it with a rotating motion.

pandemic.descr: Epidemic disease that has spread to different countries and continents.

i18n.ja: 世界的大流行, (syn.) パンデミック

pandemic preparedness.descr: Ability of a public body to deal with a threat to human health caused by a pandemic by ensuring that appropriate response plans are in place.

i18n.ja: 世界的大流行への備え

pharmacoepidemiology.descr: Study of the use and effects of drugs in large numbers of people, the aim of which is to estimate the probability of positive or negative effects of a drug.

portal of entry.descr: Anatomical site at which an infectious agent enters a host.

i18n.pt: porta de entrada, (syn.) via de entrada

portal of exit.descr: Anatomical site at which an infectious agent leaves a host.

i18n.pt: porta de saída, (syn.) via de saída

pre-symptomatic transmission.descr: Mode of transmission of an infectious disease to another person from an infected person who has not yet developed symptoms.

i18n.zh: 症状前传播, (syn.) 潜伏期传播

probable case.descr: Case that is compatible with a clinical case definition and for whom there is strong epidemiological evidence of disease, e.g. the person is a contact of a confirmed case but no laboratory test confirmation is available.

public health.descr: Science of protecting and improving the health of people through the organized efforts of society by promoting a healthy lifestyle, preventing injuries, and preventing, detecting and responding to infectious diseases.

public health surveillance.descr: Ongoing systematic collection, analysis, and dissemination of health data to help guide public health decision making and action.

i18n.fr: surveillance épidémiologique, (syn.) surveillance de santé publique
i18n.ja: 公衆衛生サーベイランス
i18n.pt: vigilância sanitária pública, (syn.) vigilância em saúde pública

quarantine.descr: Strategy adopted by a public body to keep apart from the general population for a certain period of time all individuals suspected of having contact with a person affected by an infectious disease or coming from an affected area, until it is confirmed that they have not contracted the disease.

reservoir.descr: Natural habitat in which an infectious agent normally lives, grows, and multiplies.

i18n.ja: 病原巣, (syn.) レゼルボア

respiratory disease.descr: Disease affecting the airways and the lungs and hindering normal breathing, which may be caused by, e.g., infection, air pollution, or exposure to noxious substances.

respiratory hygiene.descr: Set of practices and behaviours adopted by an individual with the aim of preventing the spread of respiratory diseases.

i18n.zh: 呼吸道卫生, (syn.) 咳嗽礼仪

risk factor.descr: Characteristic, condition, or behaviour that increases the likelihood that a person will contract a disease or sustain an injury.

i18n.ja: 危険因子, (syn.) リスク因子

ribonucleic acid.descr: Single-stranded nucleic acid whose nucleotides consist of a backbone made up by a simple sugar, called ribose, a phosphate group, and a nitrogenous base, i.e. adenine, guanine, cytosine, and uracil.

self-isolation.descr: Measure taken by an individual in order to avoid contact with other people and thus help to prevent the spread of an infectious disease.

sepsis.descr: Organ dysfunction syndrome caused by an impairment of the physiological regulatory mechanisms via which a host responds to infection.

septic shock.descr: Class of sepsis in which abnormalities of circulation, i.e. persistent hypotension despite fluid resuscitation, and/or of cellular metabolism are serious enough to increase mortality substantially.

i18n.de: schweres akutes Atemnotsyndrom, (syn.) schweres akutes Atemwegssyndrom, SARS
i18n.ja: 重症急性呼吸器症候群, (syn.) SARS
i18n.pt: síndrome respiratória aguda grave, (syn.) síndrome respiratória aguda severa, SARS
i18n.zh: 严重急性呼吸系统综合征, (syn.)非典型肺炎, SARS

i18n.es: coronavirus del síndrome respiratorio agudo grave 2, (syn.) coronavirus 2 del síndrome respiratorio agudo grave, SARS-CoV-2
i18n.ja: 新型コロナウイルス, (syn.) SARS-CoV-2
i18n.pt: coronavírus da síndrome respiratória aguda grave 2, (syn.) coronavírus 2 da síndrome respiratória aguda grave, SARS-CoV-2
i18n.ru: второй коронавирус тяжелого острого респираторного синдрома, (syn.) SARS-CoV-2
i18n.zh: 严重急性呼吸综合征冠状病毒  2, (syn.) SARS-CoV-2

spike glycoprotein.descr: Glycoprotein complex made up of three protomers and located on the envelope of coronaviruses, which enables the virus to bind to the receptor site of the host cells.

i18n.ja: スパイク糖タンパク質, (syn.) スパイク

super-spreader.descr: Person affected by an infectious disease who transmits the disease to a significantly higher number of people than does the average infected person.

i18n.ja: スーパースプレッダー

suspected case.descr: Case that is compatible with a clinical case definition but there is no laboratory test confirmation or strong epidemiological evidence, e.g. the person is not a contact of a confirmed case.

symptom.descr: Manifestation of a disease that is perceptible to only the patient (subjective symptom) or to the patient and others (objective symptom or sign).

symptomatic transmission.descr: Mode of transmission to another person of an infectious disease from an infected person who has developed symptoms.

systemic inflammatory response syndrome.descr: Condition characterized by a disproportionate inflammatory response to a variety of severe clinical phenomena, including relating to body temperature (>38°C or <36°C), heart rate (>90 beats per minute), respiratory rate (>20 breaths per minute or PaCO2 <32 mmHg), and white blood cell count (>12,000/cu mm, <4,000/cu mm, or >10% immature band forms).

i18n.es: síndrome de respuesta inflamatoria sistémica, (syn.) SRIS
i18n.fr: syndrome de réponse inflammatoire systémique, (syn.) SIRS
i18n.ja: 全身性炎症反応症候群, (syn.) SIRS
i18n.pt: síndrome da resposta inflamatória sistémica, (syn.) SIRS
i18n.zh: 全身炎症反应综合征, (syn.) SIRS

triage.descr: Process of sorting patients or casualties to determine priority of need and proper place of treatment.

urgent care.descr: Medical care provided for illnesses or injuries that require prompt attention but are typically not so serious as to require the services of an emergency room.

i18n.pt: pronto atendimento, (syn.) serviço de urgência básica, serviço de atendimento permanente, SAP, SUB

urgent care facility.descr: A walk-in clinic led by qualified medical professionals, i.e. doctors and nurses, in which urgent care is delivered.

i18n.fr: centre de soins non programmés, (syn.) service d'accueil médical non programmé
i18n.ja: 初期救急施設, (syn.) 急病診療所
i18n.pt: unidade de pronto atendimento, (syn.) centro de saúde, UPA
i18n.ru: отделение неотложной медицинской помощи, (syn.) кабинет неотложной помощи

vaccine.descr: Therapeutic preparation containing an antigen, i.e. a virus or a segment of a virus or a toxin generated by bacteria, that may have been attenuated, inactivated or killed and which is able to trigger the immune response and generate immunity in an organism.

vector.descr: Living organism that indirectly transmits an infectious disease to a susceptible host either by carrying the infectious agent on its body (mechanical vector) or by providing an environment in which the infectious agent can reproduce and survive (biological vector).

viral load.descr: Amount of viral particles present in a millilitre of a fluid sample, e.g. blood.

viral vector.descr: Virus that has been genetically modified for use in gene therapy.

virus.descr: Microscopic infectious agent that can multiply only in living cells of animals, plants, or bacteria, consisting of genetic material, either DNA or RNA, housed inside a capsid.

zoonosis.descr: Infectious disease that is transmissible under natural conditions from vertebrate animals to humans.

i18n.ja: 人獣共通感染症, (syn.) 動物由来感染症
